column3: Would it not be recommended to have some tests in (a new rpc test script in `qa/pull-tester/`and maybe a test in `rpc_wallet_tests.cpp`)?\n
@jonasschnelli Definitely yes. I'll also add missing `importaddress` tests.\n
What is the use case for this? Since watchonly really only works with complete wallets, I'm not sure it makes sense to remove addresses?\n
@luke-jr Imagine you are interested in watching some addresses. You `importaddress` them. After some time, you change your interest and want to stop watching some of them...\n

@paveljanik importaddress is designed for (and only works sanely for) watching an entire wallet by importing all of its addresses. It shouldn't be mixed in a normal wallet or used with just a single address or subset of a wallet, because that causes erratic results.\n
@luke-jr What you say causes problems is the thing I'mn doing, I imported a watch-only address into a "normal use" testing mainnet wallet...\n
@Diapolo Then you should be seeing arbitrary "send" transactions which have nothing to do with the address in question.\n
@luke-jr well, OK, but this is what we expect :-) We want to watch the added address... Such transactions should be marked as "watched" though.\n

Bug:  Needs to call EnsureWalletIsAvailable()

Otherwise, looks good to me, ut ACK modulo that issue.

... and LOCK needed IMO

```
LOCK2(cs_main, pwalletMain->cs_wallet);
```

Will rebase/test tomorrow.
Needs rebase (again). Maybe needs a bit more of an interactive rebase because of the importaddress/importscript stuff related to the fundrawtransaction watch-only modifications. Sorry about that :/\n

The rebase seems to be trivial. See here: https://github.com/laanwj/bitcoin/tree/2015_10_paveljanik_remove_watchonly

> Would it not be recommended to have some tests in (a new rpc test script in qa/pull-tester/and maybe a test in rpc_wallet_tests.cpp)?

This does still need tests. Probably best option is to adapt one of the wallet RPC tests to exercise the call.
I'm sorry but I'm a bit distracted by other project these days :-(\n
Are you still planning to do this, say, within the next weeks? Or would it be better to close for now until you can pick it up again?\n
I think we can close this and reopen later or anyone can pick up the work with your rebase. Closing.\n
